title: Senior Manufacturing Engineer - Battery System Equipment
content:
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.  
As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before. By joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team of more than  800 people who are  as passionate about changing the world as you are.  
You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.
We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life. 
We have a fantastic opportunity for an ambitious engineer experienced in battery pack assembly lines to play a key role at Lilium as we build our eVTOL jet!   In this high-impact role, you will be the driver of the equipment acquisition process for our battery factory. 
Playing a pivotal role in bringing our visionary product strategy to life, you will be instrumental in transforming it into a ground-breaking production system that spans from prototyping to an established highly automated production line.  Positioned at the forefront of identifying the best methods and technologies to produce our state-of-the-art eVTOL jet, you will also manage our equipment supplier partners. 
Every day, you will collaborate with diverse teams to develop, acquire, and install the production capabilities we need to realize Lilium's production ramp-up strategy.
Your Day to Day

Lead the end-to-end equipment acquisition and development process with external partners, from initial design concepts to commissioning and handover into operations.
Ensure manufacturability of planned machinery for all assemblies and components by coordinating with stakeholders throughout the development process.
Oversee the buy-off and commissioning (external and internal) of production equipment, ensuring smooth operation and verification.
Collaborate with technical peers to drive the implementation of key processes, including equipment, material, and process selection, to optimize volume production.
Provide guidance and suggestions for manufacturing technologies and concepts.
Implement, manage, and continuously improve production equipment and processes to facilitate global scaling of our organization.
Collaborate with Manufacturing Engineering colleagues to develop process capability for all associated components.
Drive technical and process-based improvement projects, such as root cause analysis, problem-solving, and analysis of existing processes to meet quality, delivery, and cost targets.
Engage in a global network for technology acquisition, new product designs, and modern production system solutions for all components and technologies.

About you:
We are looking for an agile team-player who can communicate effectively, with ease, across a variety of technical and business areas.  Strong analytical capabilities are important, combined with the ability to get things done using a strong sense of urgency.  You should be confident learning from failure, using challenges as an opportunity to pick up new skills and be comfortable challenging the status-quo in a professional manner. 
Strong, proven experience of equipment acquisition with at least 2 years dedicated to battery pack assembly lines is essential, along with demonstrated experience in ramping up assembly lines to serial production.  We would also like you to be proficient in writing specifications for both low-volume and high-volume assembly equipment.

Requirements: 

Degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Chemical, or Industrial Engineering.
Extensive experience in assembly production, development, and manufacturing, including material, equipment, machinery, tooling selection, and process specification.
PFMEA (Process Failure Mode and Effects Analysis) knowledge

Beneficial: 

MFMEA (Machine Failure Mode and Effects Analysis).
Lean Six Sigma certification. 
Experience in DFM (Design for Manufacturing) 

Want to know more? Then view our 'Why join Lilium' page!
Life at Lilium:
The wellbeing of our employees is a high priority. In our HQ we have many initiatives such as free healthy food and drinks, free in-house gym and health days. In remote offices we offer online opportunities to stay connected and develop yourself as well including our culture club, learning terminal, Employee Assistance Program and many more.
 Lilium is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.
